categories.name: Buying Guides
categories.description: Find out more about our range of products and get help from our experts on how to choose the one that is right for you.

categories.name: How to Guides
categories.description: From 'How to season firewood' to 'How to set up a portable generator, these 'How To' guides are designed to offer tips and advice on on a host of useful topics. Browse through and let us know if there is something you want to see here.

categories.name: Safety
categories.description:
This section is designed to offer you help and advice on operating your new garden machinery safely, so you can enjoy years of use with no issues. All mechanical equipment, electrical or petrol driven, should be treated with respect, used as the manufacturer intended and handled with care by fully alert and active operators. 

It also contains information and advice on keeping yourself safe and looking after yourself when working on your property or allotment. 

Do feel free to ask us here at MowDirect for advice, Do check out all our guides and tips and please read manuals carefully before assembling and using your new purchase.

categories.name: Assembly
categories.description: Here are some essential and no nonsense tips to help you assemble your equipment.

categories.name: Getting Going
categories.description: From starting your machine to choosing your oil, the articles in 'Getting Going' are designed to make sure you get started as soon as possible with no fuss or hassle.

categories.name: Keeping Going
categories.description: Even though we have a dedicated safety section, this Keeping Going section, designed to help you to keep your machine running successfully over its lifetime, is a combination of safety and maintenance information as the two are tied together. Maintenance is vital and an unmaintained machine is an is unsafe machine. Maintenance saves money, time in the long run and frequently saves lives and prevents injury. Safely used, well-maintained equipment is an asset and is easy and comfortable to operate. Badly maintained and carelessly used gear is a potential hazard and will let you down when you need it. Read our helpful and comprehensive maintenance tips, treat your garden equipment with respect and care, and it will last you longer and keep going.
